resources.string:
Blood flow in the heart follows a specific pathway, ensuring efficient circulation throughout the body:


1. Right Atrium: Deoxygenated blood returns from the body to the heart through the superior and inferior vena cavae, entering the right atrium.
2.Tricuspid Valve: From the right atrium, blood flows through the tricuspid valve into the right ventricle.
3. Right Ventricle: The right ventricle pumps blood through the pulmonary valve into the pulmonary artery, which carries it to the lungs for oxygenation.
4. Pulmonary Arteries and Capillaries: In the lungs, blood releases carbon dioxide and picks up oxygen through the process of gas exchange in the pulmonary capillaries.
5. Pulmonary Veins: Oxygenated blood returns from the lungs to the heart through the pulmonary veins, entering the left atrium.
6. Mitral Valve: Blood passes through the mitral valve from the left atrium into the left ventricle.
7. Left Ventricle: The left ventricle pumps oxygen-rich blood through the aortic valve into the aorta, which distributes it to the rest of the body.
Complete and submit quiz test to see result

In order to save time, you can skip questions that seem tough and return to them before submission.
 You are mandated to attempt more than half the questions.

 Once you submit your answers, you will be directed to the Result screen.
Reset result to take quiz again.

Please watch the video before proceeding.
After which, read the note on the next screen.
Then you will be asked to attempt 10 questions.
You have to answer all the questions in 10 minutes.

Your time starts when you tap the "START" button.
Oops! You were not able to finish up before time up.\nNext time, try to beat the time.
Take it one at a time
